item.title: Trump set to name replacements at the Fed and Bureau of Labor Statistics in coming days
item.description: Both spots opened up Friday through the resignation of Fed Governor Adriana Kugler and the firing of Erika McEntarfer at the BLS.

item.title: Housing to remain weakest part of economy, falling 8% in the second half, Goldman says
item.description: The Wall Street investment bank named immigration and affordability challenges as two obstacles standing in the way a housing boost.

item.title: Switzerland's tariff shock: The 39% U.S. hit no one saw coming
item.description: The duty would be a "devastating" blow to the export-reliant Swiss economy and businesses, analysts say.

item.title: Fed Governor Kugler is resigning, giving Trump a nominee on committee that sets interest rates
item.description: Her resignation now paves the way for Trump to put his own nominee in for the Board of Governors.

item.title: U.S. added just 73,000 jobs in July and numbers for prior months were revised much lower
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 100,000 in July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.
